query: Investigate Ali Khaledi Nasab an Irani AI Researcher working for Amazon
tasks: Search LinkedIn for current role and position details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic profiles related to AI authored by Ali Khaledi Nasab
Search Iranian news websites and tech media for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab's work in artificial intelligence
Investigate professional conference proceedings or speaker lists in Iran for presentations by Ali Khaledi Nasab
Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja or LinkedIn Iran for career history and professional connections
Check Iranian university alumni databases for potential educational background of Ali Khaledi Nasab
Search patent databases for AI-related patents registered under Ali Khaledi Nasab's name in Iran
Explore social media platforms (Twitter, LinkedIn) for professional or research-related posts by Ali Khaledi Nasab

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for current role and position details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
task_1.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on the company's latest Generative AI product. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Before joining Amazon, Dr. Khaledi Nasab earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he focused on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. He also held a research position at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, working on stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his professional work, Dr. Khaledi Nasab has been active in sharing his experiences and insights. In 2017, he authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," reflecting on the challenges faced by international students in the U.S. amid political changes. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

For more detailed information about his background and work, you can visit his personal website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_2.query_used: Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic profiles related to AI authored by Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian researcher with a diverse academic background, including work in physics, astronomy, and machine learning. He has authored several publications in these fields, with a notable focus on nanoscience and nonlinear dynamics. For instance, his work on the green synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles using potato extract has been cited over 100 times. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

In addition to his research contributions, Ali Khaledi Nasab has shared personal experiences related to the challenges faced by international students in the United States. In a 2017 article titled "Standing up to fear," he discusses the impact of political climate changes on his academic journey and the broader international student community. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

While his primary research has been in nanoscience and nonlinear dynamics, there is no direct evidence from the available sources indicating his involvement in artificial intelligence (AI) research.

citations.title: (PDF) Standing up to fear | Ali Khaledi Nasab - Academia.edu

task_3.query_used: Search Iranian news websites and tech media for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab's work in artificial intelligence
task_3.data: I searched Iranian news websites and tech media for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab's work in artificial intelligence but found no specific references. However, I did find information about his academic contributions. According to Exaly, Ali Khaledi Nasab is affiliated with the University of Tabriz and has an h-index of 10, indicating a significant impact in his field. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/5034433/ali-khaledi-nasab?utm_source=openai))

task_4.query_used: Investigate professional conference proceedings or speaker lists in Iran for presentations by Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_4.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab has presented his research at various professional conferences, including the 2019 American Physical Society (APS) meeting in Boston, where he discussed the dynamics of excitable tree networks and their application to sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, he has contributed to seminars at Ohio University, such as the Mathematical Biology and Dynamical Systems Seminar, where he presented on the collective dynamics of random tree networks of excitable elements. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/topics/ali-khaledi/?utm_source=openai))

However, there is no specific information available regarding his participation in professional conference proceedings or speaker lists within Iran.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Ali Khaledi Archives - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences — Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_5.query_used: Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja or LinkedIn Iran for career history and professional connections
task_5.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. Following his doctoral studies, he worked at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. In 2021, he joined CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup, as a scientist. In 2022, he transitioned to Amazon, where he currently serves as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his professional roles, Ali has been involved in various scientific projects and publications. Notably, he edited the Brain Development section of the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for "significant contributions" in Clinical Medicine. He has also published research on topics such as the dynamics of phase oscillator networks and the depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

While his personal website provides detailed information about his career and achievements, there is no specific mention of his profiles on Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja or LinkedIn Iran. This absence may be due to privacy preferences or limited online presence on these platforms.

task_6.query_used: Check Iranian university alumni databases for potential educational background of Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_6.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist who pursued his doctoral studies in Physics and Astronomy at Ohio University in the United States. His research focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. In 2019, he received the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his work on the dynamics of excitable tree networks and their application to sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Prior to his time at Ohio University, Khaledi Nasab authored a column titled "Standing up to fear" in the journal Science in 2017. In this piece, he discussed the challenges faced by international students in the U.S., particularly in light of political uncertainties affecting their status and research opportunities. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

Regarding his educational background in Iran, specific details about his undergraduate studies are not readily available in the provided sources. However, his professional and academic activities suggest a strong foundation in physics and related disciplines.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
(PDF) Standing up to fear | Ali Khaledi Nasab - Academia.edu

task_7.query_used: Search patent databases for AI-related patents registered under Ali Khaledi Nasab's name in Iran
task_7.data:
I searched patent databases for AI-related patents registered under the name Ali Khaledi Nasab in Iran but did not find any records. However, I did find a publication authored by Ali Khaledi-Nasab titled "Standing up to fear," which discusses the challenges faced by international students in the United States during the 2017 travel ban. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, there is a publication co-authored by Ali Khaledi-Nasab titled "Linear and Nonlinear Tunable Optical Properties of Intersubband Transitions in GaN/AlN Quantum Dots in Presence and Absence of Wetting Layer," published in the Journal of the European Optical Society – Rapid Publications in 2014. ([mostafa-mr.com](https://mostafa-mr.com/?utm_source=openai))

These publications suggest that Ali Khaledi-Nasab's research interests may be in the fields of optics and international student experiences, rather than artificial intelligence.

citations.title: (PDF) Standing up to fear | Ali Khaledi Nasab - Academia.edu

task_8.query_used: Explore social media platforms (Twitter, LinkedIn) for professional or research-related posts by Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon. He has a background in physics and neuroscience, with a Ph.D. from Ohio University. His research has focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. He has also contributed to the development of stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. In 2022, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In 2019, Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In 2017, he gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster on "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," discussing the stochastic dynamics of tree networks relevant to certain sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in 2017, he authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," published in Science magazine, reflecting on the challenges faced by international students in the U.S. following the Trump administration's travel ban. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

For more information about his professional journey and research, you can visit his personal website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

judgement.revised_report:
# Ali Khaledi Nasab - Professional Profile

## Current Position
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon. According to his personal website, he joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team¹. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on the company's latest Generative AI product¹.

## Educational Background
- **Ph.D. in Physics** - Ohio University (focus: collective dynamics of excitable tree networks)¹
- **Undergraduate studies** - Likely completed in Iran (specific details not available in sources)
- **Academic affiliation** - University of Tabriz (h-index: 10)³

## Career Timeline
- **Pre-2017**: Graduate studies at Ohio University
- **Post-PhD**: Research position at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery (stimulation methods for neurological disorders)¹
- **2021**: Scientist at CODA Biotherapeutics (gene therapy startup)⁵
- **2022-present**: Research Scientist at Amazon (AWS Network Capacity, then Rufus)¹⁵

## Research Contributions

### Physics and Neuroscience
- Specialized in dynamics of excitable tree networks and sensory neurons⁴⁸
- Received 2019 APS Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award⁴⁸
- Presented at 2019 American Physical Society meeting in Boston⁴
- 2017 colloquium at College of Wooster on "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection"⁸

### Publications
- Research on green synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles (100+ citations)²
- Work on dynamics of phase oscillator networks⁵
- Research on depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge⁵
- Co-authored work on optical properties of GaN/AlN Quantum Dots (2014)⁷
- Edited Brain Development section of "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health" (2024 PROSE Award)⁵

### Other Contributions
- 2017 Science magazine article "Standing up to fear" - discussing challenges faced by international students during U.S. travel ban²⁶⁷⁸

## Iranian Connections
Despite targeted searches:
- No mentions found in Iranian news websites or tech media³
- No profiles discovered on Iranian professional networking sites (Jobinja, LinkedIn Iran)⁵
- No AI-related patents registered in Iran under his name⁷
- No records of presentations at Iranian conferences⁴

## Areas of Expertise
- Physics (nonlinear dynamics, nanoscience)
- Neuroscience (neural stimulation methods)
- Machine learning and AI (current role at Amazon)
- Network capacity planning
- Generative AI products

## Notable Achievements
- 2024 PROSE Award for editorial work⁵
- 2019 APS Travel Award⁴⁸
- H-index of 10 (indicating significant academic impact)³
- Successful transition from academia to industry (Stanford → CODA → Amazon)

---
### Citations
¹ alikhaledi.com - Personal website
² Google Scholar profile
³ Exaly.com author profile
⁴ Ohio Forum (2019) - APS Travel Award announcement
⁵ alikhaledi.com - Career history
⁶ Academia.edu - "Standing up to fear" article
⁷ Mostafa-mr.com - Publication reference
⁸ Ohio Forum archives - Various announcements

### Notes on Information Gaps
- Limited information about early education in Iran
- No direct evidence of AI research publications prior to Amazon role
- Absence from Iranian professional networks may indicate focus on U.S. career
- Current work at Amazon Rufus represents recent pivot to AI/ML field
